intro: Hibbertia kimberleyensis, commonly known as Kimberley hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and has woody stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Hibbertia kimberleyensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native environment.
